critique: The document is a formal executive order regarding the exemption of a specific individual from mandatory retirement. The tone is formal and legalistic. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of confidence and assurance that the government is functioning properly and efficiently. There is a slight element of joy that Finis D. Morris is allowed to continue his service. There is no indication of sadness, anger, fear, or disgust. Surprise is possible, but unlikely, so I will set it to 1.
